list_definition.definition: the state of mind produced by something unexpected or extraordinary

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was full of wonder at the amazing sight.
the Seven Wonders of the World
You work late so often that it’s a wonder you don’t take a bed to the office!

list_definition.definition: the quality of being strange or unexpected

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The wonder of the discovery is that it was only made ten years ago.
Caroline is very fond of John – I shouldn’t wonder if she married him.
Have you ever wondered about his reasons for wanting this money?

list_definition.definition: to feel a desire to know

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I wonder what the news is.

list_ex_of_english: I wonder how many other people there were who started to write with that picture of the boy led away somewhere in their head?
Columnists wondered why a century-old conference paper came in for such blistering attacks.
You may wonder how the existence of this extra reason could avoid the instability of the reason to which it is added.
However, something extremely unlikely happens : those who witness the event do not wonder at it at all.
The reader might wonder about the role of political bias in attending to these petitioners.
As tantalizing glimpses of the fully formed wonders to come, though, they offer a valuable perspective to anyone interested in this singular composer's musical evolution.
One wonders who, part from libraries, will pay for a good deal of dross that includes a few plums.
Finally, readers with a topological background may have wondered about possible generalizations of our approach to higher dimensions.
